body: This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/498)

comment_regular_data.body: I have splitted on 4 commits to make review easier
Do we want to expose `AF_INET6` and `AF_INET` outside `network.c`? They require including system-specific network headers.

@nurupo It will be fixed in another PR. I have started this PR because during update AF_INET I found a lot of not good (ok, sometimes it's bad :smile:) code in DHT and decide to make refactor it in separate RP
Just make sure you don't change the behaviour of DHT code.
AFAIK this is the logic of `refactoring` :)

Review status: 0 of 2 files reviewed at latest revision, 9 unresolved discussions.

---

*[toxcore/DHT.c, line 527 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/498#-KeeAQeaasyaiPAGu5pW:-KeeAQebK5KUeX-nh0Pq:brfwkec) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/ff039d7f2ca9135337c6ab20820ed07c3ca92e57/toxcore/DHT.c#L527)):*
> ```C
>     uint32_t i; \
>     for (i = 0; i < size; i++) { \
>         if (id_equal(array[i].public_key, pk)) { \
> ```

This replaces use of public_key_cmp in the original with use of id_equal. This is good. Why not replace the others too?

---

*[toxcore/DHT.c, line 538 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/498#-Kee9e8shVvNneleLZVg:-Kee9e8shVvNneleLZVh:b-9exo38) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/ff039d7f2ca9135337c6ab20820ed07c3ca92e57/toxcore/DHT.c#L538)):*
> ```C
> INDEX_OF_PK(DHT_Friend)
> INDEX_OF_PK(Node_format)
> ```

Using macros to define functions makes it hard to look up the definition. Maybe only use a macro for the body, or keep it as is but add explicit function declarations?

---

*[toxcore/DHT.c, line 618 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/498#-KeeBAsfB2LgI5lNpiM5:-KeeBAsfB2LgI5lNpiM6:bmwykt3) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/ff039d7f2ca9135337c6ab20820ed07c3ca92e57/toxcore/DHT.c#L618)):*
> ```C
>      * and the one who is the actual friend's public_key/address set?
>      * MAYBE: check the other address, if valid, don't nuke? */
>     index = index_of_Client_data_ip_port(list, length, &ip_port);
> ```

The original code handled the case that an ip_port occurs multiple times in the list, updating the public key for each occurence, while the revised version does not. The same goes for repeated public keys. It is actually possible to have duplicate ip_ports, because the ip_port of an existing pk could be replaced by an ip_port which is already in the list, associated to a different pk.

---

*[toxcore/DHT.c, line 1141 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/498#-KeeCeMQQGWpUO-i3AWZ:-KeeCeMRjqC6g-wXQQx-:b-fpgdpg) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/ff039d7f2ca9135337c6ab20820ed07c3ca92e57/toxcore/DHT.c#L1141)):*
> ```C
>     if (ip_port.ip.family == TOX_AF_INET) {
>         assoc = &data->assoc4;
>     } else if (ip_port.ip.family == TOX_AF_INET6) {
> ```

Why did AF_INET become TOX_AF_INET?

---

*[toxcore/DHT.c, line 1148 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/498#-KeeC_pWEama28QsixR-:-KeeC_pZEwa4ycym8gME:b-z5zw7x) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/ff039d7f2ca9135337c6ab20820ed07c3ca92e57/toxcore/DHT.c#L1148)):*
> ```C
> 
>     assoc->ret_ip_port = ip_port;
>     assoc->ret_timestamp = temp_time;
> ```

Why not use unix_time() directly here?

---

*[toxcore/DHT.c, line 1170 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/498#-KeeCt8fC6si-SL3ZQxj:-KeeCt8gSBmzzCk67huc:b-4omwrm) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/ff039d7f2ca9135337c6ab20820ed07c3ca92e57/toxcore/DHT.c#L1170)):*
> ```C
>     uint32_t i;
> 
>     for (i = 0; i < dht->num_friends; ++i) {
> ```

Could define i here, i.e. "for (uint32_t i = 0;".

---

*[toxcore/DHT.c, line 1263 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/498#-Kee9D2WPuMfIXQ-nOCv:-Kee9D2XUj8Hae3yG3Yg:bdy00va) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/ff039d7f2ca9135337c6ab20820ed07c3ca92e57/toxcore/DHT.c#L1263)):*
> ```C
>     memcpy(plain + 1 + nodes_length, sendback_data, length);
> 
>     int crypto_size = 1 + CRYPTO_PUBLIC_KEY_SIZE + CRYPTO_NONCE_SIZE + CRYPTO_MAC_SIZE;
> ```

Here crypto_size includes CRYPTO_MAC_SIZE, but in earlier definitions it didn't. Better to be consistent?

---

*[toxcore/DHT.c, line 1278 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/498#-Kee9RSv8gd65C8HrGiA:-Kee9RSw7tekAY32JOXK:bmqmogu) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/ff039d7f2ca9135337c6ab20820ed07c3ca92e57/toxcore/DHT.c#L1278)):*
> ```C
> static int handle_getnodes(void *object, IP_Port source, const uint8_t *packet, uint16_t length, void *userdata)
> {
>     int crypto_size = 1 + CRYPTO_PUBLIC_KEY_SIZE + CRYPTO_NONCE_SIZE + CRYPTO_MAC_SIZE;
> ```

Why not include the second public key in crypto_size?

---

*[toxcore/DHT.c, line 1552 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/498#-KeeDAKtyh00SRH8UgAK:-KeeDAKucinSGWS4iyps:b-8cuenh) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/c-toxcore/blob/ff039d7f2ca9135337c6ab20820ed07c3ca92e57/toxcore/DHT.c#L1552)):*
> ```C
> 
>     DHT_Friend *frnd = &dht->friends_list[index];
>     index = index_of_Client_data_pk(frnd->client_list, MAX_FRIEND_CLIENTS, public_key);
> ```

Need to check that this index isn't -1! Return 0 if it is.

These comparisons of unsigned ints with negative values are a little odd. I don't have a good suggestion in the C type system to avoid this. One option is to pass in a `bool*` to determine success.
